opc:Property.opc:Description: The version number of the node (used to indicate changes to references of the owning node).
The version number of the view.
A small image representing the object.
The local time where the owning variable value was collected.
Whether the value of the owning variable is allowed to be null.
The string representation of the current value for a variable with an enumerated data type.
The maximum length for a string that can be stored in the owning variable.
The maximum length for a byte string that can be stored in the owning variable.
The maximum length for an array that can be stored in the owning variable.
The engineering units for the value of the owning variable.
The human readable strings associated with the values of an enumerated value (when values are sequential).
The human readable strings associated with the values of an enumerated value (when values have no sequence).
Contains the human-readable representation for each bit of the bit mask.
The input arguments for a method.
The output arguments for a method.

opc:DataType.opc:Description: An image encoded in BMP format.
An image encoded in GIF format.
An image encoded in JPEG format.
An image encoded in PNG format.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Specifies the current status and capabilities of the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The list of server URIs used by the server.
The list of namespace URIs used by the server.

opc:Variable.opc:Description: The current status of the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: A value indicating the level of service the server can provide. 255 indicates the best.
A flag indicating whether the server is currently generating audit events.
Indicates the time at which the Server is expected to be available in the state RUNNING.

opc:Object.opc:Description: Describes capabilities supported by the server.
Reports diagnostics about the server.
Server information provided by the vendor.
Describes the redundancy capabilities of the server.
Describes the namespaces supported by the server.

opc:Method.opc:Description: Returns the monitored items for a subscription.
Resends the last values cached for each data monitored item in the subscription.
Sets the durable state for the subscription.
Requests a state change in the server.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Describes the capabilities supported by the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: A list of profiles supported by the server.
A list of locales supported by the server.
The minimum sampling interval supported by the server.
The maximum number of continuation points for Browse operations per session.
The maximum number of continuation points for Query operations per session.
The maximum number of continuation points for ReadHistory operations per session.
The software certificates owned by the server.
The maximum length for an array value supported by the server.
The maximum length for a string value supported by the server.
The maximum length for a byte string value supported by the server.

opc:Object.opc:Description: Defines the limits supported by the server for different operations.
A folder for the modelling rules supported by the server.
A folder for the real time aggregates supported by the server.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: The diagnostics information for a server.

opc:Variable.opc:Description: A summary of server level diagnostics.
A list of diagnostics for each sampling interval supported by the server.
A list of diagnostics for each active subscription.

opc:Object.opc:Description: A summary of session level diagnostics.

opc:Property.opc:Description: If TRUE the diagnostics collection is enabled.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Provides a summary of session level diagnostics.

opc:Variable.opc:Description: A list of diagnostics for each active session.
A list of security related diagnostics for each active session.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A container for session level diagnostics information.

opc:Variable.opc:Description: Diagnostics information for an active session.
Security related diagnostics information for an active session.
A list of diagnostics for each subscription owned by the session.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A base type for vendor specific server information.
A base type for an object that describe how a server supports redundancy.

opc:Property.opc:Description: Indicates what style of redundancy is supported by the server.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Identifies the capabilties of server that supports transparent redundancy.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The ID of the server that is currently in use.
A list of servers in the same redundant set.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Identifies the capabilties of server that supports non-transparent redundancy.

opc:Property.opc:Description: A list of servers in the same redundant set.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Identifies the operation limits imposed by the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The maximum number of operations in a single Read request.
The maximum number of operations in a single data HistoryRead request.
The maximum number of operations in a single event HistoryRead request.
The maximum number of operations in a single Write request.
The maximum number of operations in a single data HistoryUpdate request.
The maximum number of operations in a single event HistoryUpdate request.
The maximum number of operations in a single Call request.
The maximum number of operations in a single Browse request.
The maximum number of operations in a single RegisterNodes request.
The maximum number of operations in a single TranslateBrowsePathsToNodeIds request.
The maximum number of operations in a single AddNodes, AddReferences, DeleteNodes or DeleteReferences request.
The maximum number of operations in a single MonitoredItem related request.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: An object that represents a file that can be accessed via the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The size of the file in bytes.
Whether the file is writable.
Whether the file is writable by the current user.
The current number of open file handles.
The content of the file.

opc:Method.opc:Description: Opens the file for use by the current session.
Reads a block of bytes from the file.
Writes a block of bytes to the file.
Returns the current position in the file.
Sets the current position in the file.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A file used to store a namespace exported from the server.

opc:Method.opc:Description: Updates the file by exporting the server namespace.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: Provides the metadata for a namespace used by the server.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The URI of the namespace.
The human readable string representing version of the namespace.
The publication date for the namespace.
If TRUE then the server only supports a subset of the namespace.
A list of IdTypes for nodes which are the same in every server that exposes them.
A list of ranges for numeric node ids which are the same in every server that exposes them.
A regular expression which matches string node ids are the same in every server that exposes them.

opc:Object.opc:Description: A file containing the nodes of the namespace.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A container for the namespace metadata provided by the server.

opc:Object.opc:Description: A file containing the nodes of the namespace.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: The base type for all events.

opc:Property.opc:Description: A globally unique identifier for the event.
The identifier for the event type.
The source of the event.
A description of the source of the event.
When the event occurred.
When the server received the event from the underlying system.
Information about the local time where the event originated.
A localized description of the event.
Indicates how urgent an event is.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A base type for events used to track client initiated changes to the server state.

opc:Property.opc:Description: When the action triggering the event occurred.
If TRUE the action was performed. If FALSE the action failed and the server state did not change.
The unique identifier for the server generating the event.
The log entry id provided in the request that initiated the action.
The user identity associated with the session that initiated the action.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A base type for events used to track security related changes.
A base type for events used to track related changes to a secure channel.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The identifier for the secure channel that was changed.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: An event that is raised when a secure channel is opened.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The certificate provided by the client.
The thumbprint for certificate provided by the client.
The type of request (NEW or RENEW).
The security policy used by the channel.
The security mode used by the channel.
The lifetime of the channel requested by the client.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A base type for events used to track related changes to a session.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The unique identifier for the session,.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: An event that is raised when a session is created.

opc:Property.opc:Description: The secure channel associated with the session.
The certificate provided by the client.
The thumbprint of the certificate provided by the client.
The timeout for the session.

opc:DataType.opc:Description: A mask of 32 bits that can be updated individually by using the top 32 bits as a mask.

opc:VariableType.opc:Description: A variable that contains live automation data.

opc:Property.opc:Description: A vendor-specific, human readable string that specifies how the value of this DataItem is calculated.
The maximum precision that the server can maintain for the item based on restrictions in the target environment.

opc:Argument.Name: SubscriptionId
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The identifier for the suscription to refresh.

opc:Argument.Name: MonitoredItemId
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The identifier for the monitored item to refresh.

opc:Argument.Name: SubscriptionId
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The identifier for the suscription to refresh.

opc:Argument.Name: EventId
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The identifier for the event to comment.

opc:Argument.Name: Comment
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The comment to add to the condition.

opc:Argument.Name: SelectedResponse
opc:Argument.opc:Description: The response to the dialog condition.

opc:Argument.Name: ShelvingTime
opc:Argument.opc:Description: If not 0, this parameter specifies a fixed time for which the Alarm is to be shelved.

opc:ObjectType.opc:Description: A state machine for a program.

opc:Object.opc:Description: The Program is properly initialized and may be started.
The Program is executing making progress towards completion.
The Program has been stopped prior to reaching a terminal state but may be resumed.
The Program is in a terminal or failed state, and it cannot be started or resumed without being reset.

opc:Method.opc:Description: Causes the Program to transition from the Ready state to the Running state.
Causes the Program to transition from the Running state to the Suspended state.
Causes the Program to transition from the Suspended state to the Running state.
Causes the Program to transition from the Ready, Running or Suspended state to the Halted state.
Causes the Program to transition from the Halted state to the Ready state.

opc:Object.opc:Description: At the beginning of each interval, retrieve the calculated value from the data points on either side of the requested timestamp.
Retrieve the average value of the data over the interval.
Retrieve the time weighted average data over the interval using Interpolated Bounding Values.
Retrieve the time weighted average data over the interval using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the total (time integral) of the data over the interval using Interpolated Bounding Values.
Retrieve the total (time integral) of the data over the interval using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the minimum raw value in the interval with the timestamp of the start of the interval.
Retrieve the maximum raw value in the interval with the timestamp of the start of the interval.
Retrieve the minimum value in the interval and the Timestamp of the minimum value.
Retrieve the maximum value in the interval and the Timestamp of the maximum value.
Retrieve the difference between the minimum and maximum Value over the interval.
Retrieve the minimum value in the interval including the Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the maximum value in the interval including the Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the minimum value with the actual timestamp including the Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the maximum value with the actual timestamp including the Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the difference between the Minimum2 and Maximum2 value over the interval.
Retrieve the number of Annotations in the interval.
Retrieve the number of raw values over the interval.
Retrieve the time a Boolean or numeric was in a zero state using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the time a Boolean or numeric was in a non-zero state using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the number of changes between zero and non-zero that a Boolean or Numeric value experienced in the interval.
Retrieve the value at the beginning of the interval using Interpolated Bounding Values.
Retrieve the value at the end of the interval using Interpolated Bounding Values.
Retrieve the difference between the Start and End value in the interval.
Retrieve the value at the beginning of the interval using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the value at the end of the interval using Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the difference between the StartBound and EndBound value in the interval.
Retrieve the total duration of time in the interval during which the data is good.
Retrieve the total duration of time in the interval during which the data is bad.
Retrieve the percent of data (0 to 100) in the interval which has a good StatusCode.
Retrieve the percent of data (0 to 100) in the interval which has a bad StatusCode.
Retrieve the worst StatusCode of data in the interval.
Retrieve the worst StatusCode of data in the interval including the Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the standard deviation for the interval for a sample of the population (n-1).
Retrieve the standard deviation for the interval for a complete population (n) which includes Simple Bounding Values.
Retrieve the variance for the interval as calculated by the StandardDeviationSample.
Retrieve the variance for the interval as calculated by the StandardDeviationPopulation which includes Simple Bounding Values.
